Package com.mastercard.installment.db.update.batch

Class TableUpdateWriter

java.lang.Object
com.database.operations.batch.TableUpdateWriter
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.springframework.batch.item.ItemWriter<RowDetails>
public class TableUpdateWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.batch.item.ItemWriter<RowDetails>
This Writer class do Insertion, Updation and Deletion operation on database

    private int dbDelete​(RowDetails data)
    it will create the SqlQuery using only primary key's column for delete operation and using JbbcTemplate it will do deletion on database
    private int dbInsert​(RowDetails data)
    it will create the SqlQuery using column names for Insert operation and using JdbcTemplate it will do insertion on database
    private int dbUpdate​(RowDetails data)
    it will create the SqlQuery using primary key's column and other columns for update operation and using JdbcTemplate it will do updation on database

    • write

      public void write​(java.util.List<? extends RowDetails> list)
      this function will call the appropriate method based on required operation on the data and in last it shows how much insertion, updation and deletions happened in database
      Specified by:
      write in interface org.springframework.batch.item.ItemWriter<RowDetails>
      Parameters:
      list - is the list of data which is validated in processor

    • dbInsert

      private int dbInsert​(RowDetails data)
      it will create the SqlQuery using column names for Insert operation and using JdbcTemplate it will do insertion on database
      Parameters:
      data - it contains data of one row which we want to insert in database
      Returns:
      the number of inserted row

    • dbUpdate

      private int dbUpdate​(RowDetails data)
      it will create the SqlQuery using primary key's column and other columns for update operation and using JdbcTemplate it will do updation on database
      Parameters:
      data - It contains data of one row which we want to update in database
      Returns:
      the number of updated row

    • dbDelete

      private int dbDelete​(RowDetails data)
      it will create the SqlQuery using only primary key's column for delete operation and using JbbcTemplate it will do deletion on database
      Parameters:
      data - It contains data of one row which we want to delete from database
      Returns:
      the number of deleted row
